Appearance
From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: ware, wãrẽ, warē, wäre, and -ware

English

[edit]
English Wikipedia has an article on:
Ware
Wikipedia

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • (surname): Wares

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • Audio (US):(file)

Proper noun

[edit]

Ware (countable and uncountable, plural Wares)

  1. A placename:
    1. A place in England:
      1. A hamlet in Uplyme parish, East Devon district, Devon, next to Lyme Regis in Dorset (OS grid ref SY3291)
      2. A town and civil parish in East Hertfordshire district, Hertfordshire (OS grid ref TL3614). [1]
      3. A hamlet in Ash parish, Dover district, Kent (OS grid ref TR2860).
    2. A number of places in the United States:
      1. An unincorporated community in Union County, Illinois.
      2. An unincorporated community in Sherman Township, Pocahontas County, Iowa.
      3. An unincorporated community in Casey County, Kentucky.
      4. A town and census-designated place therein, in Hampshire County, Massachusetts.
      5. An unincorporated community in Jefferson County, Missouri.
      6. Ellipsis of Ware County.
  2. (countable) A surname.

Derived terms

[edit]
  • Ware County
  • Ware Opening

References

[edit]
  1. ^ Parish map (Hertfordshire)

Anagrams

[edit]
  • Rawe, Wear, -wear, wear, arew, Awre

German

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Middle Low German ware, from Old Saxon war (“true”), from Proto-Germanic *warō (“attention, care”), from *waraz (“cautious, aware”).

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ˈvaːʁə/
  • Audio:(file)
  • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)
  • Homophone: wahre

Noun

[edit]

Ware f (genitive Ware, plural Waren)

  1. goods, merchandise, ware

Declension

[edit]
Declension of Ware [feminine]
singular plural
indef. def. noun def. noun
nominative eine die Ware die Waren
genitive einer der Ware der Waren
dative einer der Ware den Waren
accusative eine die Ware die Waren
